title: Semantics for Possibilistic Disjunctive Programs
abstract: In this paper, a possibilistic disjunctive logic programming approach for modeling uncertain, incomplete and inconsistent information is defined. This approach introduces the use of possibilistic disjunctive clauses which are able to capture incomplete information and incomplete states of a knowledge base at the same time.
histories: 37 pages, 5 figures. To appear in Theory and Practice of Logic Programming (TPLP)
COMMENTS: 37 pages, 5 figures. To appear in Theory and Practice of Logic Programming (TPLP)
